div.head: Proposition 26
div.p: As just established, there has never been just cause to go to war against the Indians, who are innocent, and were secure and peaceful in their own lands and homes. Therefore, we affirm that these wars were, are and always will be (failing some new just cause) null and void, unjust and condemned by all laws, from the Indiesâ€™ discovery until today. And the following should suffice as proof: the complaints which have been taken to all the governors and the juridical proceedings33 which against them and against many others, which are in the archive of this Royal Council, and those which every hour there and here easily can be made, because now all the world cries out against it.
